com.hazelcast.nio

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.internal.serialization.impl.HeapData
      • com.hazelcast.nio.Packet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OutboundFrame, Data

    @PrivateApi
public final class Packet
extends HeapData
implements OutboundFrame
    A Packet is a piece of data send over the line. The Packet is used for member to member communication. The Packet extends HeapData instead of wrapping it. From a design point of view this is often not the preferred solution ( prefer composition over inheritance), but in this case that would mean more object litter. Since the Packet isn't used throughout the system, this design choice is visible locally.

    • Method Detail

      • getConn

        public Connection getConn()
        Gets the Connection this Packet was send with.
        Returns:
        the Connection. Could be null.

      • setConn

        public void setConn(Connection conn)
        Sets the Connection this Packet is send with.

        This is done on the reading side of the Packet to make it possible to retrieve information about the sender of the Packet.

        Parameters:
        conn - the connection.

      • setFlag

        public Packet setFlag(int flag)
        Sets a particular flag. The other flags will not be touched.
        Parameters:
        flag - the flag to set
        Returns:
        this (for fluent interface)

      • setAllFlags

        public Packet setAllFlags(int flags)
        Sets all flags at once. The old flags will be completely overwritten by the new flags. The reason this method accepts an int instead of a short is that Java immediately converts to ints, so you would have to do bit shifting logic to down cast to a short all the time.*
        Parameters:
        flags - the flags.
        Returns:
        this (for fluent interface)

      • isFlagSet

        public boolean isFlagSet(int flag)
        Checks if a flag is set.
        Parameters:
        flag - the flag to check
        Returns:
        true if the flag is set, false otherwise.

      • getFlags

        public short getFlags()
        Returns the flags of the Packet. The flags is used to figure out what the content is of this Packet before the actual payload needs to be processed.
        Returns:
        the flags.

      • getPartitionId

        public int getPartitionId()
        Returns the partition id of this packet. If this packet is not for a particular partition, -1 is returned.
        Returns:
        the partition id.

      • reset

        public void reset()

      • isUrgent

        public boolean isUrgent()
        Description copied from interface: OutboundFrame
        Checks if this Frame is urgent. Frames that are urgent, have priority above regular frames. This is useful to implement System Operations so that they can be send faster than regular operations; especially when the system is under load you want these operations have precedence.
        Specified by:
        isUrgent in interface OutboundFrame
        Returns:
        true if urgent, false otherwise.
